conversation_log.content:
Coder, here’s your step-by-step plan:

1. In publisher.py, change the QoS settings:
   • Replace the line that sets writer_qos.durability.kind from VOLATILE to TRANSIENT_LOCAL.
   • Replace the line that sets writer_qos.reliability.kind from BEST_EFFORT to RELIABLE.
   • Set writer_qos.history.kind to KEEP_ALL.
   • Increase the final sleep duration from 0.5 seconds to around 3.0 seconds to allow the subscriber extra time to receive cached samples.

2. In subscriber.py, similarly change the QoS settings:
   • Replace the line that sets reader_qos.durability.kind from VOLATILE to TRANSIENT_LOCAL.
   • Replace the line that sets reader_qos.reliability.kind from BEST_EFFORT to RELIABLE.
   • Set reader_qos.history.kind to KEEP_ALL.

3. After making these changes in both files, run the provided test_durability.py script. The test should simulate random startup orders. It must receive all 10/10 samples in every run.

4. Test early after each change to ensure you’re making progress.

Once you’ve done these modifications, run the tests and report back on the results.

Let’s start with making these changes in publisher.py and subscriber.py according to the above instructions, then test again.

2. Change the reliability setting from BEST_EFFORT to RELIABLE.  
3. Insert a new line to set the history kind to KEEP_ALL right after the reliability configuration.  
4. Increase the final sleep duration from 0.5 seconds to 3.0 seconds.
